column3: Instrument of Accession Alwar
column9: The Instrument of Accession is an agreement signed by the rulers of the various princely state which acceeded to the Dominion of India after independence. This is an agreement signed by the ruler of Alwar, His Highness Shri Sewai Maharaj Tejsinghji Alwarendra Dev making an acceptance of all the clauses and vesting all the powers of the State in the hands of the Dominion of India according to the the Government of India Act, 1935 . It includes an agreement stating the formation of laws recommended by the Dominion Legislature in the fields of defence, external affairs, communications and ancillary related to the State after its accession. A reference to the Indian Arbitration Act, 1899 has also been included in the agreement if in case of any dispute that arises out of the overall agreement.
column16: Shri Sewai Maharaj Tejsinghji Alwarendra Dev

column3: Instrument of Accession Anandpur Taluka
column9: The Instrument of Accession is an agreement signed by the rulers of the various princely state which acceeded to the Dominion of India after independence. This is an agreement signed by the four talukdars of the taluka Anandpur which is attached to the state and by signing the Instrument of Accession agreement authorises the Dominion of India, with due effect, to exercise all the powers and jurisdiction of the taluka.

column3: Instrument of Accession Jira Kamsoli
column9: The Instrument of Accession is an agreement signed by the rulers of the various princely state which acceeded to the Dominion of India after independence. This is an agreement signed by the nine talukdars of the taluka Jiral Kamsoli under Sankheda-Mewas Thana which is attached to the former Gujarat State Region and by signing the Instrument of Accession agreement authorises the Dominion of India, with due effect, to exercise all the powers and jurisdiction of the taluka.

column3: Instrument of Accession Bamanbore Taluka
column9: The Instrument of Accession is an agreement signed by the rulers of the various princely state which acceeded to the Dominion of India after independence. This is an agreement signed by the talukdar of the Bamanbore taluka under Chotila Thana which is attached to the former Western India State Region and by signing the Instrument of Accession agreement authorises the Dominion of India, with due effect, to exercise all the powers and jurisdiction of the taluka.

column3: Instrument of Accession Dudhpur
column9: The Instrument of Accession is an agreement signed by the rulers of the various princely state which acceeded to the Dominion of India after independence. This is an agreement signed by the talukdar of the Dudhpur taluka under Sankheda-Mewas Thana which is attached to the former Gujarat State Region and by signing the Instrument of Accession agreement authorises the Dominion of India, with due effect, to exercise all the powers and jurisdiction of the taluka.

column3: Agony of Partition
column9: Agony of Partition is documentary film which shows division of peaceful country by British by "Divide and Rule".  Film shows India's Independence movement and problems after independence. Film focuses on Communal riots in India, Partion of India etc due to British rules.
column14: Division of India by Communal Basis

column3: A Man of Silence: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel"
column9: A Man of Silence: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel is a documentary film. This films shows journey of sardar Vallabhbhai Patel from student to active member of Indian National Congress. Film also shows Sardar Patel's personal life.
column22: Museum of Sardar Patel in Gujarat

column3: India Independent
column9: India Independent  is a documentary film which shows India's culture,civilization and struggle for freedom from 1757 to 1947. Film also shows Mahatma Gandhi's Satyagragh,Dandi and Quit India movements, Independence day celebrations on 15th August,1947 and speeches at first constitution assembly, New Delhi.

column3: India News Review
column9: This is documentary film shows Lord Mountbatten's last speech in India and leaving to London. Film also shows Mr. C Rajgopalachari's oath ceremony as next Governer General of India in 1948.

column3: India wins freedom
column9: India wins Freedom is a documentary film shows Mountbatten's plan of division of India, Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehrus' visits to different places i.e.Bengal, Bihar, Naokhali and Punjab. Film also shows Independance Day celebration and Flag hosting by Pandit Nehru on 15th August, 1947.
